Talk_0026:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>And the one who caused all of this...<sp:5:0:0>was
a <clr:0000>blond-haired woman<clr:ffff>, you say?<sp:5:0:0> Hmm.
Could that have been...
Talk_3003:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:SurpriseS_01>Violynne! That wasn't it at all!


Why, you moved the heart of the Great
Fairy herself with your violin. Your playing
is impeccable.
Talk_0027:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:QuestionNormal_00>Whatever reasons the Great Fairy has
for hiding herself away, we thought a
<clr:0000>performance <clr:ffff>would cheer her up.
<sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:Sad_01>But with <clr:0000>Breezer<clr:ffff> broken down, we
can't transport our small troupe or
our instruments there.
Talk_3004:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:LaughS>I guess...<sp:5:0:0>I really did do that, didn't I?


I've heard the <clr:0000>other Great Fairies <clr:ffff>also
are hiding away in their buds...

<sp:3:0:2:0800>I bet if you—I mean, we—play music for
them, that'd cheer them up too!
Talk_0028:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Look way up those hills. See that big
plant in the distance, the one that's
spouting that pretty stuff?
That right there is the flower bud where
the Great Fairy lives.

They say she really likes this <clr:0000>musical
troupe<clr:ffff>, and that's why she moved near
the stable recently.
A Great Fairy who loves this troupe's
<clr:0000>music performances<clr:ffff>?<sp:5:0:0> That alone is
something worth looking into.
Talk_3005:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>A brilliant idea! And you know what that
calls for? Reuniting our troupe...

<sp:0:2:2:7d00>The Stable Trotters!<sp:0:2:2:6400>
Talk_0029:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>We mustn't forget that the Great Fairy
bestows <clr:0000>protective blessings<clr:ffff> on travelers!

Her presence is essential to the stable.<sp:5:1:0>
I do hope we can help her soon.
Talk_0030:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>If only we had a <clr:0000>way to reach her<clr:ffff>...


But <clr:0000>Breezer<clr:ffff> is broken, and we don't go
anywhere without it. Not to mention, our
<clr:0000>horse<clr:ffff> is gone. We're stuck here.
Talk_3006:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughS_01>Thank you for helping us get here.
It means a lot to me.

We're a troupe of two for now. But, oh,
you just wait! I just know we'll get the
other musicians back with us somehow!
Talk_0031:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Happy>Oh! Hello there, partner! I didn't know
you were out this way!

I didn't notice you just now on account
of the rain.
Talk_0032:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:SurpriseS>Hold on! You have to learn to flap before
you can soar, after all. Let's give you
the rundown on the Great Fairy first.
Talk_3008:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>Now that that's decided, we should get
ready for our journey, Violynne!

Let's hurry to the other <clr:0000>Great Fairies
and bring them out of hiding<clr:ffff>!
Talk_0033:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:LaughS>Ha! Asking all the right questions. Good
instincts, kid. You'll make a decent
reporter yet.
Talk_3009:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Ahhh...<sp:5:0:0> I couldn't resist coming out to
bask in your beautiful music.

Now that I'm outside, I see that the
world is not at all how Princess Zelda
described it to me.
She warned me that an awful gloom was
spreading over the land, and that the
world would soon be lost to monsters.
I hid myself away.


<sp:3:0:2:0c00>But now that I look back on it, while
Princess Zelda was speaking to me, I had
the feeling something wasn't right.
In the deep dark of that night, I couldn't
see her face clearly. Maybe it was
<clr:0000>someone else<clr:ffff> entirely...
Talk_3010:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:QuestionNormal>I was about to return to my spring and its
sweet serenity...<sp:5:0:0>when I heard those two
mention my sisters.
There are four of us across this land,
you know.
Talk_0034:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>What are you thinking, partner? The
members of the troupe mentioned a 
woman with blond hair...
<sp:3:0:2:0c01><sp:0:2:2:5000>I think it might be Princess Zelda!<sp:0:2:2:6400>


<sp:3:0:2:0700>We should check in with the Great Fairy
and find out what she saw, but if she
won't show herself, hm...
Maybe we can get her to come out if we
bring the musicians to her somehow?

<sp:3:0:2:0c01>Their <clr:0000>wagon<clr:ffff> is busted though. What do
we do...
Talk_0035:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>If only our music could reach the Great
Fairy from here. But it can't.
Talk_0036:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>And we can't go anywhere if our <clr:0000>Breezer<clr:ffff>
won't budge.
Talk_0037:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Violynne! He's made some sort of
change to <clr:0000>Breezer<clr:ffff>.

We may be able to be on our way now.
Quick, let's get in. We wouldn't want to
be left behind!
Talk_3014:
<snd:TalkPositive>You will find my sisters in their flower
buds. They're as scared as I was to come
out of hiding.
Talk_0038:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:QuestionNormal_00>Oh!<sp:5:0:0> You're taking the troupe members
up to the Great Fairy, partner? That's
impressive.
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>I suspect that the blond-haired woman
the troupe members saw might be
Princess Zelda.
<sp:3:0:2:0701>But we can't just write that in the paper
without any proof.
Talk_0039:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>My vision isn't that great when
it's raining...
Talk_0040:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>But first, you'll need to get the <clr:0000>troupe
members<clr:ffff> up to the <clr:0000>Great Fairy<clr:ffff> safely.
Talk_0041:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Happy>The <clr:0000>Great Fairy<clr:ffff> is just up the mountain.
She lives inside a <clr:0000>flower bud<clr:ffff>!
Talk_3017:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I've been worried about our safety, but
after hearing the musical troupe, I feel
much better.
May I ask...<sp:5:0:0>if you find the other buds,
could you talk to my sisters?

Oh, and while you're here, how about I
enhance your clothes for you?
Talk_0100:
<sp:3:0:2:0500><snd:Think>Should we tell the newspaper...<sp:5:0:0>what
happened here?
Talk_0043:
Our beloved <clr:0000>Breezer<clr:ffff>!


Some of its <clr:0000>wheels<clr:ffff> broke, and now we
can't even transport our instruments to
performances! Or us!
Talk_0101:
<sp:3:0:2:0900>Absolutely. We'll tell this whole awful
story to the <clr:0000>Lucky Clover Gazette<clr:ffff> and no
one else. They'll take it seriously!
Talk_2000:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Thank you. We can take it from here!


All right, Mastro, lead us into the
performance...
Talk_0044:
<sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:Sad_01>At least no one was hurt.


But since that night, the Great Fairy has
been hiding in her <clr:0000>bud<clr:ffff>. She seems afraid
of something.
Talk_0102:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>I don't know how we'll get word of this
to them though...

The <clr:0000>Lucky Clover Gazette<clr:ffff> is in the Hebra
region. They're working out of a stable,
I heard. That's all so far west though...
CarryNpc_Vio_Talk_07:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Our little troupe must play with all the
heart we can—for the Great Fairy!
Talk_0047:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>The <clr:0000>Great Fairy<clr:ffff> is inside that flower bud
just up the road.

If she comes out, make sure to get the
whole story from her!
Talk_0001:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Angry_01>All right...<sp:5:0:0> Mind going through it all one
more time, just to make sure I have all
the details correct?
What happened that night when the
<clr:0000>Great Fairy<clr:ffff> hid herself away?
Talk_0049:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:QuestionNormal>What are you doing?


Please don't do anything strange like
that to our dear <clr:0000>Breezer<clr:ffff>.
Talk_0050:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:QuestionNormal>I think you're going in the wrong
direction. We need to go to the
Great Fairy.
Talk_0051:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>If you're not going to head for the Great
Fairy, then I'm sorry to say that we'll
be returning to the stable.
Talk_0004:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>The Great Fairy's presence is essential to
the stable.<sp:5:1:0> I wish we could <clr:0000>perform<clr:ffff> for
her. I think she'd feel better then!
Talk_0005:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>Is there trouble?! I do hate trouble!


<sp:3:0:2:0700>But as soon as it's safe, we must press
on! Fetch us from the stable when we
can continue.
Talk_0053:
<sp:3:0:2:0b01>Wh...<snd:Notice>what's this? We can't get into
<clr:0000>Breezer<clr:ffff> if something's where we sit!
Talk_0054:
<sp:3:0:2:0b01>Wh...<snd:Notice>what's this?


We couldn't possibly get into <clr:0000>Breezer<clr:ffff>
while it's in such a state!
Talk_0007:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>My first ride in a while. Feels new.
Away we go!
Talk_0055:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>N-no! Our poor Breezer! Let's put out
this wretched blaze!
Talk_0056: <sp:3:0:2:0a00>Phew! I was worried for a moment.
Talk_0057:
<sp:3:0:2:0900>Our dear Breezer is part of our musical
family. Please, be careful!
Talk_0011:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Think_00>Well, <sp:5:0:0>we had our accident here one awful
night, some time after the Upheaval.

We saw the Great Fairy nearby...<sp:5:0:0>vanish
from view. It was troubling somehow.
We got in our wagon to go to her.
That's when it happened...
Talk_0012:
<sp:3:0:2:0900><snd:Angry_00>Frightful, the whole thing!


That's when the<clr:0000> woman with blond hair<clr:ffff>
jumped out in front of us.

Our <clr:0000>horse<clr:ffff> bolted away—off it ran, into
the night.

<snd:Sad_00>But the real tragedy! That involved
one of the most crucial members of
our troupe...
Talk_0059:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>Yeeek! <sp:5:1:0>What's happening?!<sp:0:4:0>Please don't jostle our Breezer!
It's very delicate!
Talk_0060:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseL><sp:0:2:2:7d00>Aaaaaagh! <sp:5:1:0>Stop that!<sp:0:4:0><sp:0:2:2:6400>If you keep jostling the Breezer, we're
going to head back.
Talk_0013:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>But some <clr:0000>wheels <clr:ffff>came off and broke in
our accident.
Talk_0061:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>Urp... <sp:5:0:0>I'm... I'm not feeling well after all
of that. <sp:5:0:0>I can't do this anymore.<sp:0:4:0>We should head back.
Talk_0014:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Our <clr:0000>Breezer<clr:ffff> takes us and our instruments
from place to place...
Talk_0062:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>Please don't jostle the Breezer too much
when we're in it. Spare a thought for your
poor passengers!
Talk_0015:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>You have perfect timing though. Sorry to
spring this on you so suddenly, but we've
got work to do.
These fine <clr:0000>musicians<clr:ffff> here were just
telling me an interesting tale.

Apparently, the Great Fairy who lives near
this stable has shut herself away in her
flower bud.
Why, you ask? Well, it seems to have
something to do with a mysterious
<clr:0000>blond-haired woman<clr:ffff>.
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>My reporter instincts are calling out!
Could the mystery woman be her?

<sp:0:2:2:5000>Could she be <clr:0000>Princess Zelda<clr:ffff>?<sp:0:2:2:6400>


<sp:3:0:2:0700>Of course, we can't put anything to print
until we're sure it's true, so we have to
talk to the <clr:0000>Great Fairy<clr:ffff>, first.
Talk_0063:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>Yeeek! What's going on?! <sp:5:0:0>The Breezer
is rocking!
Talk_0016:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><clr:0000>Breezer <clr:ffff>is broken, and we don't go
anywhere without it. And of course, our
<clr:0000>horse <clr:ffff>ran off too.
Talk_0017:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01>And it isn't going anywhere without
a <clr:0000>horse<clr:ffff>.
Talk_0124:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>I'll try to think of a <clr:0000>way to reach the
Great Fairy<clr:ffff>.
Talk_5001:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Well, look at this! You really helped out
here, partner.
Talk_0021:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00><snd:Ease>That was close. A little too close,
I must say.

<sp:3:0:2:0701>I suppose we'd better try again.
Talk_5002:
<sp:3:0:2:0801>I flew here as fast as I could when I saw
the bud opening up.
Talk_0022:
<sp:3:0:2:0200><snd:Angry_01>It was that woman, I tell you! She did
something to the Great Fairy!

She's a villain twice over! She left the
scene of our tragic accident without so
much as an apology.
Talk_0023:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Happy>Oh! Hello there, partner! I didn't know
you were out this way!
Talk_3000:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Behold, Violynne! The Great Fairy graces
us with her presence!
Talk_5004:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>What? How did our poor <clr:0000>Breezer<clr:ffff> get all
the way over there? Let's get it back
right away!
Talk_4003:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>So, she looked like Princess Zelda...<sp:5:0:0>but
wasn't Princess Zelda.<sp:5:0:0> I don't like the
sound of that at all.
<sp:3:0:2:0701>I think our reporting work might be
taking a darker turn here.

<sp:3:0:2:0801>On the bright side, the Great Fairy is out
of hiding, and that's a big scoop!

I've got to take wing and get this news
written up for the newspaper!
Talk_5005:
<sp:3:0:2:0900>That is no average wagon or common
cart. It's as much of a performing member
of our troupe as any of us!
It would simply be a disaster for our
traveling band if our dear vehicle ever
got away from us.
Talk_4004:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>OK, I'm going to take this story and
head back! This article will keep readers
hanging on to every word!
Talk_3002:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Think>Mastro...<sp:5:0:0> I thought...<sp:5:1:0>the rest of our
musicians left the troupe because they
didn't like how I played my violin.
